DataElement.preferredName: PET Isotope Standardized Uptake Value (SUV) Integer::60 Minute Sweep Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for Standardized Uptake Value (SUV) of a radioisotope at the 60 minute point in a PET scan.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PET Isotope Standardized Uptake Value (SUV) Integer::60 Minute Sweep
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Movement  in an arc of a sensing device from the chin through the torso to measure regional tracer uptake of a radioactive tracer._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::30_A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::60_A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:Substances having the same number of protons in their nuclei and hence having the same atomic number, but differing in the number of neutrons and therefore, in the mass number.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
A form of a chemical element containing a specific number of neutrons and a specific atomic mass.

Property.preferredName: Standardized Uptake Value Integer::60 Minute Sweep
Property.preferredDefinition: An effectively dimensionless measure of regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) 1[injected dose (nCi) 1 body weight (g)].:A number with no fractional part.::60:A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.:A movement in an arc over a specified body part or area.

Concepts.definition: An effectively dimensionless measure of regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) / [injected dose (nCi) / body weight (g)].
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.
A movement in an arc over a specified body part or area.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/19/08 - released.  2/14/08- Created to support curation of ACRIN PET CDEs; Univ of WASH FES, FMISO studies.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A decimal quantity to measure regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) 1[injected dose (nCi) 1 body weight (g)].

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An effectively dimensionless measure of regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) 1[injected dose (nCi) 1 body weight (g)].:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: An effectively dimensionless measure of regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) / [injected dose (nCi) / body weight (g)].
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2/19/08 - released  2/14/08 - created for Univ of Washington FES study.
